Text: Whew...

You seem tired. Not that I blame you, this break
couldn't have come sooner...

Yeah. I was constantly surprised by the unexpected
evaluation process.

I was, too. It was a format I've never experienced
before... Honestly, I was taken aback.
That said, I find it quite refreshing and engaging.
I feel the same as well.

...If my niece were here, would my spirits be lifted
even higher?
Lady Beatrix...
...I'm sorry. I didn't mean to make you worry.

You really care a lot about your family, don't you,
Lady Beatrix? Your relentless search for your niece
has taken you to various places...

Well, it's for someone important to me... Wouldn't
you do the same, Princess Iris?

Yes...I'm sure I would undertake the same search if I
were separated from my sister...from Alexia.

Indeed... Heheh. Your sister is lucky to have such a
caring big sister.

No, I don't think I've been a good big sister...
Lately, she's been distant from me.

Every time we cross paths, she runs away. It's like
she's deliberately avoiding me...

I'm sure there's a reason... Have you asked her
directly?
...No. Maybe I'm scared to ask.
I don't get it. Why are you scared of your family?

Alexia... She's changed lately. She's made friends I
don't know and often spends time alone, looking
conflicted.

The distance between us might be because of the
change in Alexia... She's probably going through
a phase.

It could also be that she's grown. That's not a bad
thing.
Yes, of course.

But being her big sister, my curiosity gets the best
of me. I really want to ask, "What happened?" But I
can't bring myself to...
Why...can't you?

I think I'm afraid...of history repeating itself.
I don't want to see her suffer because of
something I say.
I'm sure it's best...if I don't intervene.

How someone receives words is up to the individual.
Sometimes, you may unintentionally hurt them, but...

Still, if you don't put your feelings into words,
you can't convey them.

(Lady Beatrix is right. In my desire not to hurt my
sister, I've turned myself into a coward...)

(But the way things are now, the day we truly
understand each other may never come.)

...After this contest is over, I'll confront Alexia
and talk to her.

I don't know how she'll react, but I still want to...
tell her how I feel.
...Heheh. That's a great smile.
Huh? R-Really...?

I'm sure your love for your sister brought it out.
Family really is a wonderful thing.
...Yes, I agree.

The final evaluation will start shortly. Please
proceed to the venue!

Is it already that time? Maybe we spent too much time
chatting.
No, it was time very well spent. Thank you.

From here on out, we'll be rivals once more.
Let's fight fair and square to the end...!
Yes. Let's both give it our all. I'm counting on you.
